skills.name: Quadratic equations
skills.description: Solve quadratic equations by factoring, completing the square, and quadratic formula

templates.stem: Solve x² + {a}x + {b} = 0 by factoring
templates.hint: Look for two numbers that multiply to {b} and add to {a}.

templates.stem: Solve {a}x² + {b}x + {c} = 0 using quadratic formula
templates.hint: Use x = [-b ± √(b² - 4ac)] / 2a. Calculate the discriminant first.

templates.stem: Find the discriminant of {a}x² + {b}x + {c} = 0 and describe the nature of roots
templates.hint: The discriminant is b² - 4ac. If Δ > 0 (two roots), Δ = 0 (one root), Δ < 0 (no real roots).

skills.name: Simultaneous equations
skills.description: Solve systems of linear equations

templates.stem: Solve: {a}x + {b}y = {c}, {d}x + {e}y = {f}
templates.hint: Use elimination or substitution. Multiply one equation to make coefficients equal.

templates.stem: Solve by substitution: y = {a}x + {b}, {c}x + {d}y = {e}
templates.hint: Substitute the first equation into the second, then solve for x.

skills.name: Polynomial operations
skills.description: Expand, factor, and simplify polynomials

templates.stem: Factor {a}x² + {b}x + {c}
templates.hint: Find factors of ac that add to b. Then group and factor out common terms.

templates.stem: Factorise {a}x² + {b}x + {c} completely.
templates.hint: Check if there's a common factor first. Then use the AC method.

skills.name: Trigonometric identities
skills.description: Prove and use basic trig identities

templates.stem: Prove tan θ = sin θ / cos θ
templates.answer: Use definitions: sin θ = opposite/hypotenuse, cos θ = adjacent/hypotenuse
templates.hint: Start with the definitions of sine and cosine in a right triangle. Divide them together.

skills.name: Statistical inference
skills.description: Confidence intervals and hypothesis testing basics

templates.stem: Find the median of: {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, {e}
templates.hint: Arrange the numbers in order. The median is the middle value.

skills.name: Trigonometric exact values
skills.description: Find exact values of trig ratios for special angles

templates.stem: Find the exact value of sin({angle}°).
templates.hint: Recall the exact values: sin(30°) = 1/2, sin(45°) = √2/2, sin(60°) = √3/2.

skills.name: Matrix inverse
skills.description: Find the inverse of 2×2 matrices

templates.stem: Find the inverse of the matrix [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]] (ad - bc ≠ 0).
templates.hint: For [[a,b],[c,d]], the inverse is (1/determinant) × [[d,-b],[-c,a]].

skills.name: Normal distribution
skills.description: Calculate probabilities using the normal distribution

templates.stem: IQ scores are normally distributed with mean 100 and standard deviation 15. What percentage have IQ > {score}? Answer to nearest percent.
templates.hint: Standardize the score: z = (score - mean) / SD. Use the standard normal table.

skills.name: Quadratic discriminant
skills.description: Use the discriminant to determine nature of roots

templates.stem: For the quadratic {a}x² + {b}x + {c} = 0, find the discriminant and state the nature of the roots.
templates.hint: Discriminant = b² - 4ac. Two roots if > 0, one if = 0, none if < 0.

skills.name: Simplifying surds
skills.description: Simplify radical expressions

templates.stem: Simplify √{n}.
templates.hint: Find the largest perfect square that divides {n}. Factor it out of the radical.

skills.name: Rationalising denominators
skills.description: Simplify radical expressions using conjugates

templates.stem: Rationalise the denominator of 1 / (sqrt({a}) - sqrt({b})).
templates.hint: Multiply by the conjugate (sqrt(a) + sqrt(b)) / (sqrt(a) + sqrt(b)).

skills.name: Best buy problems
skills.description: Compare unit prices and ratios

templates.stem: Brand A: {a}g for ${pa}. Brand B: {b}g for ${pb}. Which is better value?
templates.hint: Calculate price per gram for each brand. Compare: divide price by weight.

skills.name: Solving nonlinear systems
skills.description: Solve nonlinear simultaneous equations graphically

templates.stem: The line y = {m}x + {c} intersects y = x² - {k} at two points. Find the positive x-coordinate to 2 d.p.
templates.hint: Set the equations equal: {m}x + {c} = x² - {k}. Rearrange to standard form and solve.

skills.name: Matrix operations
skills.description: Addition, multiplication, determinants

templates.stem: Multiply matrices [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]] × [[{e},{f}],[{g},{h}]]
templates.hint: Use row-by-column multiplication. First row × first column gives first element.

templates.stem: Find the inverse of [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]]
templates.hint: First calculate the determinant ad - bc. Then use the formula for 2×2 inverse.

skills.name: Circle geometry
skills.description: Equations, properties, theorems

templates.stem: Find the center and radius of x² + y² + {a}x + {b}y = {c}
templates.hint: Complete the square for both x and y terms to find the center and radius.

skills.name: Bivariate data analysis
skills.description: Correlation, regression lines

templates.stem: Data: x = {x1},{x2},{x3}; y = {y1},{y2},{y3}. Find correlation coefficient
templates.hint: Use the correlation formula r = Σ(xy) - nxy / √[Σ(x²) - nx²][Σ(y²) - ny²].

skills.name: Complex numbers - polar form
skills.description: Convert between rectangular and polar form

templates.stem: Convert {a} + {b}i to polar form r∠θ° (θ to nearest degree).
templates.hint: r = √(a² + b²) and θ = arctan(b/a). Check which quadrant to adjust angle.

skills.name: Applications of calculus
skills.description: Optimization, rates of change, curve sketching

templates.stem: Find critical points of f(x) = x³ - {a}x² + {b}x
templates.hint: Take the derivative and set it equal to zero. Solve for x.

skills.name: Complex numbers
skills.description: Operations with complex numbers, polar form, De Moivre's theorem

templates.stem: Solve z² = {a} + {b}i
templates.hint: Convert to polar form first, then use De Moivre's theorem to find square roots.

skills.name: Polynomial functions
skills.description: Remainder theorem, factor theorem, polynomial division

templates.stem: If (x - {a}) is a factor of x³ + bx² + {c}x + {d}, find b
templates.hint: Use the factor theorem: if (x - a) is a factor, then f(a) = 0.
